public long getCreationTimeOut()
Description copied from interface: BasePooling
Returns the maximum amount of time (in millis) the Pool.obtainObject() method should block before throwing an exception when the pool is exhausted. When less than or equal to 0, the Pool.obtainObject() method may block indefinitely.

getMinEvictableIdleTime

public long getMinEvictableIdleTime()
Description copied from interface: BasePooling
Returns the minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle object evictor (if any). When non-positive, no objects will be evicted from the pool due to idle time alone.

isLifo

public boolean isLifo()
Description copied from interface: BasePooling
Whether or not the idle object pool acts as a LIFO queue. True means that Pool.obtainObject() returns the most recently used ("last in") idle object in the pool (if there are idle instances available). False means that the pool behaves as a FIFO queue - objects are taken from the idle object pool in the order that they are returned to the pool.

Specified by:
isLifo in interface BasePooling

isTestOnObtain

public boolean isTestOnObtain()
Description copied from interface: BasePooling
When true, objects will be validated before being returned by the Pool.obtainObject() method. If the object fails to validate, it will be dropped from the pool, and we will attempt to borrow another.

Specified by:
isTestOnObtain in interface BasePooling

isTestWhileIdle

public boolean isTestWhileIdle()
Description copied from interface: BasePooling
When true, objects will be validated by the idle object evictor (if any). If an object fails to validate, it will be dropped from the pool.

Specified by:
isTestWhileIdle in interface BasePooling

setCanBePooled

public void setCanBePooled(boolean canBePooled)
Description copied from interface: BasePooling
When true, objects will be validated by CanBePooled.canBePooled() before being returned to the pool within the Pool.returnObject(java.lang.Object).

Specified by:
setCanBePooled in interface BasePooling
Parameters:
canBePooled - true so objects will be validated after returned to Pool.returnObject(java.lang.Object).

setLifo

public void setLifo(boolean lifo)
Description copied from interface: BasePooling
Sets the LIFO property of the pool. True means that borrowObject returns the most recently used ("last in") idle object in the pool (if there are idle instances available). False means that the pool behaves as a FIFO queue - objects are taken from the idle object pool in the order that they are returned to the pool.

Specified by:
setLifo in interface BasePooling
Parameters:
lifo - the new value for the LIFO property

Sets the maximum the number of idle instances in the pool.

Specified by:
setMaxIdle in interface BasePooling
Parameters:
maxIdle - The cap on the number of "idle" instances in the pool. Use a negative value to indicate an unlimited number of idle instances.

setNumTestsPerEvictionRun

public void setNumTestsPerEvictionRun(int numTestsPerEvictionRun)
Description copied from interface: BasePooling
Sets the max number of objects to examine during each run of the idle object evictor thread. This property limits the number of objects to examine in each eviction run, if such a thread is running.

Specified by:
setNumTestsPerEvictionRun in interface BasePooling
Parameters:
numTestsPerEvictionRun - max number of objects to examine during each evictor run.

setSoftMinEvictableIdleTime

public void setSoftMinEvictableIdleTime(long softMinEvictableIdleTime)
Description copied from interface: BasePooling
Sets the minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction by the idle object evictor (if any), with the extra condition that at least "minIdle" amount of object remain in the pool. When non-positive, no objects will be evicted from the pool due to idle time alone.

Specified by:
setSoftMinEvictableIdleTime in interface BasePooling
Parameters:
softMinEvictableIdleTime - minimum amount of time an object may sit idle in the pool before it is eligible for eviction.

setTestOnObtain

public void setTestOnObtain(boolean testOnObtain)
Description copied from interface: BasePooling
When true, objects will be validated before being returned by the Pool.obtainObject() method. If the object fails to validate, it will be dropped from the pool, and we will attempt to borrow another.

Specified by:
setTestOnObtain in interface BasePooling
Parameters:
testOnObtain - true if objects should be validated before being obtained.

setTestWhileIdle

public void setTestWhileIdle(boolean testWhileIdle)
Description copied from interface: BasePooling
When true, objects will be validated by the idle object evictor (if any). If an object fails to validate, it will be dropped from the pool.

Specified by:
setTestWhileIdle in interface BasePooling
Parameters:
testWhileIdle - true so objects will be validated by the evictor.

Specified by:
setTimeBetweenEvictionRuns in interface BasePooling
Parameters:
timeBetweenEvictionRuns - number of milliseconds to sleep between evictor runs.

activate

public void activate()
Description copied from interface: Initializing
Invoked by the container after it has set all bean properties supplied (and satisfied ProviderAware and DefinitionAware). This method allows the bean instance to perform initialization only possible when all bean properties have been set.
